geninfo.para: The AWARE module part number has been corrected.

This AFC applies to certain International models with the AWARE VEHICLE INTELLIGENCE. International Truck and Engine has determined AWARE modules may be experiencing a communication issue resulting in modules not communicating regularly. Some vehicles require only Software (SW) update, while others need a new module and Software (New Module and SW update). The VIN list below describes which repair the AWARE module requires.

partsinfo.para: Following part number is only for VIN's requiring the new module.

svcproc.title: service procedure

warning.para: To avoid personal injury or death, shift transmission to park or neutral, set parking brake, and block wheels before doing diagnostic or service procedures.
To prevent personal injury or death, remove ground cable from negative terminal of main battery before disconnecting electrical components. Always connect ground cable last.

step1.para: Call AWARE Customer Support 1-888-883-5362 to ensure maintenance of historical AWARE data.
Disconnect the negative battery cable(s) at the battery box.
Locate AWARE Module - location varies by truck model (see section 4 of the installation manual)
Disconnect GPS Antenna and Cellular Antenna.
Remove four fastening bolts from AWARE Module.
Disconnect AWARE Module from the AWARE telematics harness disconnecting the two Deutsch connectors (J1 and J2 Connector) and remove module.
Connect the AWARE telematics harness to the new AWARE module with the two Deutsch connectors. The connectors are keyed and should be aligned before inserting.
Secure new AWARE module with four fastening bolts.
Connect GPS Antenna and Cellular Antenna.

svcproc.para:
Follow sections 9-11 of AWARE module installation manual
(https://evalue.internationaldelivers.com/customer/telematicscustomer/telwcmsg/)
to update software and activate module-high level steps listed below.
10.2 Import Templates into Diamond Logic Builder

para.emph: IMPORTANT- Please call AWARE CUSTOMER SUPPORT at 1-888-883-5362 option 4 to confirm module is communicating correctly.

laborinfo.para: Operation number must appear on all claims.

claims.para: Expense is to be charged to Warranty. Claims are to be submitted in the normal manner, making reference to Authorized Field Change Number G-07902

It is important that the coding be completed properly to assist in processing the warranty claim. Complete instructions will be found in the Warranty Manual, Section 7-1. Special attention should be given to Items 39 through 44.

To assure this important improvement is made in a timely manner, all claims for G-07902 activity must be submitted by April 30, 2008 or within the normal warranty period for the vehicle, if after April 30, 2008.
